abstract: DealBook has compiled a chronology of Silver Lake’s bidding history for Dell, stretching well back to the early days of the computer company’s deliberations about whether to go private.
snippet: DealBook has compiled a chronology of Silver Lake’s bidding history for Dell, stretching well back to the early days of the computer company’s deliberations about whether to go private.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders may still be irate over the $13.65 a share that Michael S. Dell has bid for the company that bears his name.

headline.main: Timeline: How Michael Dell’s Takeover Bid Got Hatched

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Buried in Dell’s proxy filings is a presentation that JPMorgan Chase bankers delivered to a special committee of Dell’s board on Jan. 18, explaining the downsides of alternatives to a full leveraged buyout.
snippet: Buried in Dell’s proxy filings is a presentation that JPMorgan Chase bankers delivered to a special committee of Dell’s board on Jan. 18, explaining the downsides of alternatives to a full leveraged buyout.
lead_paragraph: Dell Inc. directors have repeatedly emphasized that they considered all potential ways to improve value for shareholders before accepting a $24.4 billion takeover bid by Michael S. Dell and the investment firm Silver Lake.

headline.main: What Dell Thought of Alternatives to the Silver Lake Proposal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
